context_bundle.summary: Ansible agentless automation: uses SSH (Linux) or WinRM (Windows) to execute playbooks (YAML tasks) on inventory hosts. Modules: apt, yum, service, copy, template, shell, file. Idempotent tasks ensure desired state. Inventory defines hosts/groups. Variables via group_vars, host_vars. Roles organize reusable components. ansible-playbook site.yml -i inventory. Ad-hoc: ansible all -m ping.

onboarding.quick_start: Ansible basics: create inventory file (hosts: [webservers] server1.com), write playbook.yml with - hosts: webservers, tasks: - name: Install nginx, apt: name=nginx state=present. Run: ansible-playbook playbook.yml -i inventory. Ad-hoc commands: ansible all -m ping, ansible webservers -m shell -a 'uptime'. Use modules (apt, yum, service, copy) for idempotency. Organize with roles: roles/webserver/tasks/main.yml. Variables: group_vars/all.yml, {{ variable }}.
common_patterns: Playbook: - hosts: all, become: yes, tasks: []
Start service: - service: name=nginx state=started enabled=yes
Run playbook: ansible-playbook site.yml -i inventory -l webservers
